backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining an application submission system with types for career status, program, and application form, plus functions to submit, retrieve, and list applications stored in a map.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping three implemented features—Refund Policy footer link, RefundPolicyPage content, and /refund-policy route registration—to their respective source files and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Auto-generated JSON catalog providing one-line summaries of every frontend source file, used as a build-planning reference for the project's component and page structure.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark color themes including background, foreground, chart, and sidebar tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML shell with viewport meta tag, page title 'AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator', and a root div that mounts the React app via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router setup defining all application routes (home, program landing pages, apply, about, terms, privacy policy, and refund policy) under a shared Layout root route.
frontend/src/components/CareerDemandSect: Marketing section displaying US/Canada salary ranges ($95K–$180K), a career growth image, and a no-coding-required callout for the AI infrastructure program.
frontend/src/components/CareerServicesSe: Section listing six included career services (resume review, mock interviews, job search strategy, LinkedIn optimization, negotiation coaching, career planning) with icons and descriptions.
frontend/src/components/CompaniesLogoSec: Section displaying a grid of six company names (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Deloitte, Accenture, IBM) with placeholder icons representing companies where alumni have interviewed.
frontend/src/components/CurriculumSectio: Four-phase 8-month curriculum section rendered as cards, covering Tech Foundations, Cloud Engineering, Kubernetes & Scaling, and AI + Cloud Integration with topics and durations.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCar: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section displaying six career support services (resume rewriting, LinkedIn optimization, SQL prep, etc.) as icon cards.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCur: Displays the five-phase program curriculum (SQL, Python, Data Engineering, AI Integration, BI/Visualization) as a grid of cards with topics and outcomes per phase.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFAQ: Renders a FAQ section with six common questions about the program using an accordion component.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFin: Final call-to-action section urging visitors to apply for the next cohort with a link to the apply page.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsHer: Hero section for the Data Analytics program page featuring the program title, tagline, key skill icons, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsOpp: Highlights the market opportunity by listing in-demand skills and displaying average US salary ranges for Data Analyst, Analytics Engineer, and Data Engineer roles.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPri: Justifies the $2,999 program price by contrasting what the program is not (self-paced videos, tutorials) versus what it includes (mentorship, projects, career support) with an apply CTA.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPro: Displays the program format details (8-month duration, live sessions, labs, cohort size, etc.) as icon cards with a note about selective admission.
Showcases five portfolio projects students will build (sales dashboard, marketing analytics, data pipeline, AI reporting tool, business presentation) as cards.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsTar: Describes the target audience for the program (business graduates, career switchers, international students, etc.) as icon cards, with a callout emphasizing no math or coding prerequisites.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsWhy: Renders a section explaining why the Data Analytics program exists by displaying a grid of common problems with most data courses, each shown with an X icon.
frontend/src/components/DifferentiationS: Displays a section contrasting what the program is NOT (bootcamp, generic IT training, self-paced videos) with what it IS, using X and Check icon cards.
frontend/src/components/FAQSection.tsx: Renders an accordion-based FAQ section with seven questions covering prerequisites, time commitment, job outcomes, payment plans, and program differences.
frontend/src/components/FeaturedPrograms: Displays three featured program cards (Infrastructure, Data Analytics, QA Automation) with badges, descriptions, and links to their respective detail pages.
A final call-to-action section with an Apply Now button linking to /apply and a Schedule a Call button, promoting a $100K+ career launch.
frontend/src/components/FutureProofSecti: Highlights why infrastructure engineers are future-proof by listing tasks AI cannot perform and emphasizing strategic thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration skills.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Hero section for the infrastructure program page featuring a headline, five skill icons (Cloud, Data, Networking, Security, AI), and Apply/Download CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/HomeFAQSection.t: A condensed home-page FAQ accordion with four questions covering beginner-friendliness, job placement, cohort language/timezone, and differentiation from low-cost courses.
Main homepage hero section with a headline targeting career switchers, program highlights (8 months, live cohorts, mentors), and Apply/Brochure CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/HowItWorksSectio: Explains the three-step program process—Apply, Learn & Build, and Launch—using icons and descriptions, with Apply and Schedule a Call CTAs.
frontend/src/components/ImpactCountersSe: Displays a section with four key impact metrics (students enrolled, projects built, 1:1 hours, interview-ready grads) in a responsive grid layout.
frontend/src/components/InstructorSectio: Renders an instructor profile section highlighting certifications, real-world experience, and track record using icon cards alongside an instructor photo.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Defines the main app layout with a sticky header (navigation and program dropdown), a footer with a newsletter signup form, and an Outlet for page content.
frontend/src/components/LeadCaptureSecti: Provides a lead capture form card for scheduling a free admissions call, collecting name, email, phone, and preferred call time, with a success confirmation state.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioProject: Shows a grid of four portfolio projects students will complete, each with an image, title, description, and a GitHub link indicator.
frontend/src/components/PricingSection.t: Displays a single pricing card at $2,999 listing all included features, an ROI callout showing average $45k salary increase, and a link to the apply page.
frontend/src/components/ProgramStructure: Presents the program structure with six feature cards (duration, cohort model, limited seats, mentorship, recorded access, community) and a phase-icons image.
Lists five real-world infrastructure projects (cloud architecture, data pipeline, AI deployment, Kubernetes, CI/CD) with icons and descriptions, plus two illustrative images.
frontend/src/components/QACareerServices: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section displaying six career services (resume writing, LinkedIn optimization, interview prep, mock interviews, behavioral training, and a 60-day job plan) as a grid of icon cards.
frontend/src/components/QACurriculumSect: Defines and renders a detailed 3-month curriculum breakdown for the QA program, displaying weekly topics, AI labs, and projects organized by month using cards and badges.
frontend/src/components/QAFAQSection.tsx: Renders a FAQ section with five accordion items covering beginner-friendliness, automation coverage, AI's role, hiring outcomes, and program differentiation.
frontend/src/components/QAFinalCTASectio: Displays a final call-to-action section urging users to apply for the next cohort, with a headline, supporting copy, and a link button to the apply page.
frontend/src/components/QAHeroSection.ts: Renders the hero section for the QA program page, featuring a headline, program tagline, an AI-threat warning callout, key skill icons, and a cohort application button.
frontend/src/components/QAOpportunitySec: Displays a 'Why AI-Augmented QA?' section contrasting what AI can already automate versus what the program teaches, along with US salary range cards.
frontend/src/components/QAOutcomesSectio: Renders a 'Program Outcomes' section listing seven skills graduates will have, displayed as a two-column grid of icon-and-text cards.
frontend/src/components/QAPricingSection: Displays the program's pricing section showing a $1,999 one-time investment with a side-by-side comparison of what the program is not versus what it is, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/QAProgramStructu: Renders the program format and time commitment section, showing seven structural features (duration, live sessions, projects, hours, cohort model, support, admission) as icon cards with a note about active learning.
frontend/src/components/QAProjectsSectio: Renders a section displaying six QA program portfolio deliverables (GitHub framework, API tests, CI pipeline, etc.) as cards with icons, plus a closing callout about graduating with a real GitHub portfolio.
frontend/src/components/QATargetAudience: Displays a grid of target audience personas for the QA program (career switchers, graduates, international students, etc.) with icons, plus a highlighted callout about the program's pace.
frontend/src/components/TargetAudienceSe: Shows a list of target audience profiles for the general program using checkmark cards, with a highlighted note that no prior coding experience is required.
frontend/src/components/TestimonialsSect: Renders three student testimonial cards with quotes, avatars, names, and roles for social proof on the marketing site.
Presents three core program features (cohort learning, career accelerator, AI curriculum) as icon-based feature blocks with a trust tagline below.
frontend/src/components/WhyStackTeacherS: Lists five differentiators for Stack Teacher (portfolio projects, mentor cohorts, interview training, AI-native curriculum, placement coaching) as cards with check icons.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useApplicationForm.ts: Custom hook that exposes a `submitApplication` mutation function wrapping the backend actor call, with loading and error state, and invalidates the applications query on success.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an `InternetIdentityProvider` and `useInternetIdentity` hook for managing ICP Internet Identity authentication state, including login, logout, and persisted identity across page reloads.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports two React Query hooks—`useGetAllApplications` and `useGetApplication`—for fetching application data from the ICP backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS file that sets up Tailwind directives and defines light/dark mode CSS custom properties for the design system color tokens using OKLCH values.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider` into the DOM root.
frontend/src/pages/AboutPage.tsx: Renders the About page for Stack Teacher, describing the platform's mission, offerings, target audiences, AI-era capabilities, career services, and approach using sections with icons and cards.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationForm.tsx: Provides a multi-field application form for users to apply to a program, handling form state, validation, and submission via the useApplicationForm hook before navigating to a success page.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationSuccess.ts: Displays a confirmation page after a successful application submission, outlining the next steps (review, interview, decision) and prompting the user to return home.
frontend/src/pages/DataAnalyticsLandingP: Composes the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator landing page by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Composes the main home page by assembling all homepage section components, including hero, programs, testimonials, FAQ, and lead capture.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Composes the AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator landing page by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/PrivacyPolicyPage.tsx: Renders the full Privacy Policy page with sections covering data collection, usage, cookies, and user rights, along with a sticky header linking back to the home page.
Composes the AI-Augmented QA Automation Engineer Program landing page by assembling all relevant QA section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/RefundPolicyPage.tsx: Renders the full Refund & Cancellation Policy page for Stack Teacher, including an opening disclaimer, cancellation/refund conditions, exceptional refund requests, legal framework sections, and a contact link to support@stackteacher.com.
frontend/src/pages/TermsOfUsePage.tsx: Renders the Terms of Service page for Stack Teacher, covering sections on terms of use, confidentiality/non-disclosure, use license, and other legal provisions.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom colors (mapped to CSS variables), font families (Inter, Cal Sans, JetBrains Mono), border radius, box shadows, and accordion animations; includes the animate and typography plugins.
project_state.json: Tracks the StackTeacher project state at version 3, listing completed features (refund policy page, route registration, footer link) and a pending action request to add a Refund & Cancellation Policy section to the footer with Stack Teacher branding and address.
